credit_line: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund and through gift of Mrs. Edward Stern
dimensions: 18 x 18 cm (7 1/16 x 7 1/16 in.) fringed on all sides
title: Flora's Retinue: Bluebelle
medium:
Medium: warp: linen; weft: silk
Technique: damask, 4 & 1 satin
description: Small square doily, fringed on all sides, with an ivory linen warp and a bronze-colored silk weft. A figure of a woman dressed as a bluebell with and framed by bluebells, with the word Bluebell in the upper left, all appearing in ivory on a bronze-colored ground. A set of six, the doilies would have been used on the table as part of a dessert service.
name: Doily
